text: To clarify: you definitely must have a license to Canton Enterprise to use the KMS drivers. This is spelled out clearly in the docs.

elements.text: To clarify: you definitely must have a license to Canton Enterprise to use the KMS drivers. This is spelled out clearly in the docs.

text: Yes, I saw that in the document. Could you please share the commercial terms for this license, and whether it requires annual renewal or another renewal schedule, as I do not recall reviewing the commercial requirements previously, and let us know if there are any specific limitations or additional requirements when using the KMS driver in production environments on GCP or AWS? Apologies if these are basic questions.

text: I initiated the request for whitelisting. Here are instructions for <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_onboarding.html#validating-that-your-ip-has-been-approved|how to verify>. It takes a little bit of time (up to 7 days) as  2/3rds of the SVs need to adopt that whitelist.

text:
Hi <@U0821PFKM0V>. Our validator can’t reach the TestNet Scan yet — HTTPS to
<https://scan.sv-1.test.global.canton.network.sync.global> on port 443 times out from our egress IP.

Egress IP (TestNet): 174.138.176.6
Checks:
• ping resolves, but curl/nc to 443 => timeout
• no local egress firewall (UFW inactive, no OUTPUT 443 drops)

Could you please confirm this IP is on the TestNet allowlist and let us know the ETA for propagation (≥ 2/3 SV adoption)?
If anything else is needed from our side, happy to provide. Thanks!

text: Honestly never tried this but my guess is that you are not port forwarding a number of API endpoints that the single page application needs to have access to. I would expect you to see connection timeouts in the Debug / Developer window of the browser
